title: Arrests made after 3-year-old girl shot and killed in Detroit
content:
DETROIT - Detroit police have arrested two suspects in relation to an Easter morning shooting that killed a 3-year-old girl and injured two men on Detroit's west side, reports say.
According to WXYZ, police believe the men both fired weapons inside of the home in the 16800 block of Riverview.
Police told MLive on Sunday that they were looking for one suspect. Police told media that the shooter entered the house, began firing shots, reloaded, and fired some more.
At the time, Detroit Police Sgt. Michael Woody said he did not know what motivated the shooting.
CBS Detroit reports Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan said the "city is just much too violent" after the shooting.
Police are still looking for a third suspect, CBS reports.
Ian Thibodeau is the business and development reporter for MLive Media Group in Detroit. He can be reached at ithibode@mlive.com, or follow him on Twitter.
